Events-TransitionEvent.summary: The TransitionEvent interface represents events providing information related to transitions.
Events-TransitionEvent.title: TransitionEvent

Events-TransitionEvent-elapsedTime.summary: The TransitionEvent.elapsedTime read-only property is a float giving the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, when this event fired. This value is not affected by the transition-delay property.
Events-TransitionEvent-elapsedTime.title: TransitionEvent.elapsedTime

Events-TransitionEvent-propertyName.summary: The TransitionEvent.transitionName read-only property is a DOMString containing the name of the CSS property associated with the transition.
Events-TransitionEvent-propertyName.title: TransitionEvent.animationName

Events-TransitionEvent-pseudoElement.summary: The TransitionEvent.pseudoElement read-only property is a DOMString, starting with '::', containing the name of the pseudo-element the animation runs on. If the transition doesn't run on a pseudo-element but on the element, an empty string: ''.
Events-TransitionEvent-pseudoElement.title: TransitionEvent.pseudoElement

animatable-css.summary: The bottom CSS property participates in specifying the vertical position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer versions before 7, when both top and bottom are specified, the element position is overconstrained and the top property has precedence; the computed value of bottom is set to -top, while its specified value is ignored.

animatable-css.title: bottom

animatable-css.summary: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the currentcolor value.
animatable-css.title: color

animatable-css.summary: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font.
animatable-css.title: font-size

animatable-css.summary: The font-weight CSS property specifies the weight (or boldness) of the font. The font weights available to you will depend on the font-family you are using. Some fonts are only available in normal and bold.
animatable-css.title: font-weight

animatable-css.summary: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element. By default, the property defines the height of the content area. If box-sizing is set to border-box, however, it instead determines the height of the border area.
animatable-css.title: height

animatable-css.summary: The left CSS property participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.
animatable-css.title: left

animatable-css.summary: The letter-spacing CSS property sets the spacing behavior between text characters.
animatable-css.title: letter-spacing

animatable-css.summary: The line-height CSS property sets the amount of space used for lines, such as in text. On block-level elements, it specifies the minimum height of line boxes within the element. On non-replaced inline elements, it specifies the height that is used to calculate line box height.
animatable-css.title: line-height

animatable-css.summary: The margin-bottom CSS property sets the margin area on the bottom of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
animatable-css.title: margin-bottom

animatable-css.summary: The margin-left CSS property sets the margin area on the left side of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
animatable-css.title: margin-left

animatable-css.summary: The margin-right CSS property sets the margin area on the right side of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
animatable-css.title: margin-right

animatable-css.summary: The margin-top CSS property sets the margin area on the top of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
animatable-css.title: margin-top

animatable-css.summary: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.
animatable-css.title: margin

animatable-css.summary: The max-height CSS property sets the maximum height of an element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-height.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-height with table undefined. Firefox supports applying max-height to table elements.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-height with table undefined. Opera supports applying max-height to table elements.

animatable-css.title: max-height

animatable-css.summary: The max-width CSS property sets the maximum width of an element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming larger than the value specified by max-width.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-width with table undefined. Firefox supports applying max-width to table elements.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-width with table undefined. Opera supports applying max-width to table elements.

animatable-css.title: max-width

animatable-css.summary: The min-height CSS property sets the minimum height of an element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-height with table undefined. Firefox supports applying min-height to table elements.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 10 and 11, a min-height declaration on a column-direction flex container doesn't apply to the container's flex items. See Flexbug #3 for more info.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-height with table undefined. Opera supports applying min-height to table elements.

animatable-css.title: min-height

animatable-css.summary: The min-width CSS property sets the minimum width of an element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-width.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-width with table undefined. Firefox supports applying min-width to table elements.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-width with table undefined. Opera supports applying min-width to table elements.

animatable-css.title: min-width

animatable-css.summary: The opacity CSS property sets the transparency of an element or the degree to which content behind an element is visible.
animatable-css.title: opacity

animatable-css.summary: The outline-color CSS property sets the color of an element's outline.
animatable-css.title: outline-color

animatable-css.summary: The outline-offset CSS property sets the amount of space between an outline and the edge or border of an element.
animatable-css.title: outline-offset

animatable-css.summary: The outline-width CSS property sets the thickness of an element's outline. An outline is a line that is drawn around an element, outside the border.
animatable-css.title: outline-width

animatable-css.summary: The padding-bottom CSS property sets the height of the padding area on the bottom of an element.
animatable-css.title: padding-bottom

animatable-css.summary: The padding-left CSS property sets the width of the padding area on the left side of an element.
animatable-css.title: padding-left

animatable-css.summary: The padding-right CSS property sets the width of the padding area on the right side of an element.
animatable-css.title: padding-right

animatable-css.summary: The padding-top padding area on the top of an element.
animatable-css.title: padding-top

animatable-css.summary: The padding CSS property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, and padding-left.
animatable-css.title: padding

animatable-css.summary: The right CSS property participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.
animatable-css.title: right

animatable-css.summary: The text-indent CSS property sets the length of empty space (indentation) that is put before lines of text in a block.
animatable-css.title: text-indent

animatable-css.summary: The text-shadow CSS property adds shadows to text. It accepts a comma-separated list of shadows to be applied to the text and any of its decorations.

notes: Firefox versions before 57 have a bug whereby transitions will not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (bug 726550).
From Firefox 4, the blur radius is capped at 300 for performance reasons.
Firefox theoretically supports infinite text-shadows (don't try it).
If the <color> value is unspecified, then Firefox uses the value of the element's color property.
Opera supports a maximum of 6-9 text-shadows for performance reasons. The blur radius is limited to 100px.
Opera 9.5 to 10.1 adheres to the old, reverse painting order (in CSS2, the first specified shadow is on the bottom).
In Safari, any shadows that do not explicitly specify a color are transparent.
Safari 1.1 to 3.2 only supports one text-shadow (displays the first shadow of a comma-separated list and ignores the rest). Safari 4.0 (WebKit 528) and later support multiple text-shadows.

animatable-css.title: text-shadow

animatable-css.summary: The top CSS property participates in specifying the vertical position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer versions before 7, when both top and bottom are specified, the element position is overconstrained and the top property has precedence; the computed value of bottom is set to -top, while its specified value is ignored.

animatable-css.title: top

animatable-css.summary: The vertical-align CSS property  sets vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell box.
animatable-css.title: vertical-align

animatable-css.summary: The visibility CSS property shows or hides an element without changing the layout of a document. The property can also hide rows or columns in a table.

notes: Internet Explorer doesn't support visibility: initial.
Up to Internet Explorer 7, descendants of hidden elements will still be invisible even if they have visibility set to visible.

animatable-css.title: visibility

animatable-css.summary: The width CSS property sets an element's width. By default it sets the width of the content area, but if box-sizing is set to border-box, it sets the width of the border area.
animatable-css.title: width

animatable-css.summary: The word-spacing CSS property sets the length of space between words and between tags.
animatable-css.title: word-spacing

animatable-css.summary: The z-index CSS property sets the z-order of a positioned element and its descendants or flex items. Overlapping elements with a larger z-index cover those with a smaller one.
animatable-css.title: z-index

animatable-properties.summary: In CSS, ::after creates a pseudo-element that is the last child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property.

notes: Before Firefox 57, Firefox had a bug where ::after pseudo-elements were still generated, even if the content property value were set to normal or none.
Before Firefox 3.5, only the CSS level 2 behavior of :after was supported, which disallowed position, float, list-style-* and some display properties.

animatable-properties.title: ::after (:after)

animatable-properties.summary: In CSS, ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property.

notes: Before Firefox 57, Firefox had a bug where ::before pseudo-elements were still generated, even if the content property value were set to normal or none.
Before Firefox 3.5, only the CSS level 2 behavior of :before was supported, which disallowed position, float, list-style-* and some display properties.

animatable-properties.title: ::before (:before)

dom-transitionevent-transitionevent.summary: The TransitionEvent() constructor returns a newly created TransitionEvent, representing an event in relation with an transition.
dom-transitionevent-transitionevent.title: TransitionEvent()

ontransitioncancel.summary: The ontransitioncancel property of the GlobalEventHandlers mixin is an EventHandler that processes transitioncancel events.
ontransitioncancel.title: GlobalEventHandlers.ontransitioncancel

ontransitionend.summary: The ontransitionend property of the GlobalEventHandlers mixin is an EventHandler that processes transitionend events.
ontransitionend.title: GlobalEventHandlers.ontransitionend

transition-delay-property.summary: The transition-delay CSS property specifies the duration to wait before starting a property's transition effect when its value changes.
transition-delay-property.title: transition-delay

transition-duration.summary: The transition-duration CSS property sets the length of time a transition animation should take to complete. By default, the value is 0s, meaning that no animation will occur.
transition-duration.title: transition-duration

transition-property-property.summary: The transition-property CSS property sets the CSS properties to which a transition effect should be applied.
transition-property-property.title: transition-property

transition-shorthand-property.summary: The transition CSS property is a shorthand property for transition-property, transition-duration, transition-timing-function, and transition-delay.

notes: Before Firefox 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).

Before Firefox 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).

Before Firefox 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).
Before Firefox 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).

Before Firefox 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).

Before Firefox 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).

transition-shorthand-property.title: transition

transition-timing-function.summary: The single-transition-timing-function CSS data type denotes a mathematical function that describes how fast one-dimensional values change during animations. This lets you vary the animation's speed over the course of its duration.
transition-timing-function.title: <single-transition-timing-function>

transition-timing-function-property.summary: The transition-timing-function CSS property sets how intermediate values are calculated for CSS properties being affected by a transition effect.
transition-timing-function-property.title: transition-timing-function
